author: gd_0
content:
I think there will still be cases where the option for trusted payments will be used. e.g., if there is a tail event block worth a massive amount of eth, we might not have enough staked to cover it.

On the smart contract point - a huge amount of node operators use contracts to receive payments, has anyone asked them how much of a pain it will be for them to change? If it's significant, I wonder if they will only allow trusted payments?

author: potuz
content:

I spent a big chunk of last year talking to Lido about this. The whole trustless payment system was redesigned because it made it simpler for them to track on withdrawals instead of transfers. Still is an uplift and requires contract changes to use them

author: potuz
content: So I suspect they will only allow trusted payments at the start

author: potuz
content: there's nothing in the spec and I'm against putting anything on CL clients towards this. Titan suggested that the CL client should not accept bids from P2P after they "sent" the request for bids on trusted builders. I'm strongly against this. Honest behavior should be request at 0 with a deadline. Evaluate at that deadline everything you got.  Clients that want to play timing games, acting rationally, will try to make that deadline larger, but still are inclined to evaluate and continue listening on the p2p layer until the very last moment as well
